name: Famous People's Middle Names Quiz | Name Game | 10 Questions

questions.text: What famous world leader's middle name was 'Karamchand'?
questions.explanation:
Gandhi.

	Gandhi's real name was 'Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi'. He was called 'Mahatma' which means 'great soul'.

questions.text: Booker Washington, a famous African-American educator and speechmaker, had a middle name that began with T. What did the 'T' stand for?
questions.explanation:
Taliaferro.

	Like many former American slaves, Booker chose his own middle name, Taliaferro.

questions.text: Robert Warren, U.S. poet and writer of such novels as 'All the King's Men', had a fitting middle name. What was it?
questions.explanation:
Penn.

	The book, 'All the King's Men', was based on the career of the Louisiana politician, Huey Long. Warren won pulitzer prizes in both poetry and prose, the only author to receive such an honor.

questions.text: Which U.S. president had the unusual middle name 'Gamaliel'?
questions.explanation:
Warren Harding.

	Warren Harding served a corruption filled couple years in office before his tragic death, one of the several presidents to die in office.

questions.text: You always hear actor George Scott referred to with his middle initial 'C'. But what does that 'C' stand for?
questions.explanation:
Campbell.

	You might have heard of his son, Campbell Scott, who is also a Hollywood actor, and obviously named after his father.

questions.text: U.S. admiral David Farragut had an unusual middle name, the name of a Scottish city. Which city's name also served as his middle name?
questions.explanation:
Glasgow.

	Admiral Farragut was a naval hero of the U.S. civil war, and his parents were obviously fond of Scotland.

questions.text: One of the following poets used his middle name as his pen name. Which one was it?
questions.explanation:
Rudyard Kipling.

	He was born 'Joseph Rudyard Kipling' but chose his more unique and interesting middle name Rudyard as his working name. (No offense to all you Josephs out there.)

questions.text: What is generally used as the middle name of the Austrian composer Mozart despite the fact that it was NOT one of his baptismal names?
questions.explanation:
Amadeus.

	Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, or 'Wolfie' if you're someone close. His baptismal names were Johannes Chrysostomus Wolfgangus Theophilus.

questions.text: Nikita Khrushchev and Mikhail Gorbachev shared what middle name?
questions.explanation:
Sergeyevich.

	If you take a look, you'll notice that lots of Russian male middle names end in '-vich' or '-vitch'. The '-vich' or '-vitch' denotes 'son of...'. Thus both Gorbachev and Khrushchev were sons of Sergei.

questions.text: The 16th-17th century Flemish painter Peter Rubens seems to have had parents that were fond of the apostles. What was his middle name?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	Peter, Paul ... also the name of a candy company, go figure.
